meanings.definition: A person who guards, protects, or looks after something.
meanings.sent1: The brave guardian stood watch over the treasure chest.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper acted as a guardian for the animals in the sanctuary.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy dog thought he was the guardian of the house, barking at every passing car.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse served as a guardian, guiding ships safely through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: In the fairy tale, the magical sword was the only guardian against the evil sorcerer.

meanings.definition: A person legally responsible for the care and management of a minor or incompetent person.
meanings.sent1: The court appointed her as the guardian of the orphaned siblings.
meanings.sent2: The aunt became the legal guardian of her niece after her parents passed away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child jokingly called his older sister the guardian of bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl was seen as the guardian of the forest, watching over all its inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was not only a guardian of the city but also a mentor to the young sidekick.

meanings.definition: A protective device or safety feature.
meanings.sent1: The helmet acted as a guardian for his head during the bike ride.
meanings.sent2: The firewall on the computer served as a guardian against online threats.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella became his guardian against the unexpected rain shower.
meanings.sent4: The seatbelt in the car was a silent guardian, ready to protect in case of a sudden stop.
meanings.sent5: The sunscreen lotion was the guardian of her skin, shielding it from harmful UV rays.
